intro: Peucedanum camdebooense, commonly known as the Camdeboo mountain angelica, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
